body:
Thanks a lot for reporting!

We absolutely want to fix this, but we will almost certainly need to have a way to reproduce the issue.
It would also be very useful to know if the problem persists with `3.18.4` and `3.19.0` (for the time being, you'll have to use `io.quarkus` as the groupId to test this)
@geoand, also produces error on `3.18.4` and `3.19.0`.  I updated the description to indicate that the issue seems to be scoped to `quarkus-junit5` updates.

rename.from: Upgrading from 3.18.2 to 3.18.3 Results in OutOfMemoryError when using @QuarkusTest
rename.to: Upgrading from 3.18.2 to 3.18.3 Results in OutOfMemoryError when using @QuarkusTest with Quarkus Junit 5

body: I will try to come up with a reproducer.

What could help understanding whatâ€™s going on is to get a heap dump on OOM (Iâ€™m on my phone but you should find it easily) and have a closer look at whatâ€™s going on. 

If your tests donâ€™t contain any private information, we can give you our emails so that you can share the dump if youâ€™re not used to the exercise. 

Might give us some hints on how to reproduce it.

I did a quick test, and in our case, when I created a custom `quarkus.test.class-orderer` with the changes reverted from https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/commit/820360362c2ae76fc1e97f541ff85f157a363907, the `OutOfMemoryError` goes away.

Thanks for that information!

That confirms that we are keeping something around that we shouldn't be. If you provide a heap dump or a sample project, I am pretty sure we can pinpoint the problem and fix it
Maybe I should revert the change in the meantime? I still have time before I push 3.19.1 tomorrow.
That being said, we probably want to get to the bottom of it so if we get more reports, it might help.
Right, I think we can hold off on reverting and only do it we get a lot of complaints and no reproducers

I am unable to provide a heap dump unfortunately due to company security policies.

If it helps, we also use Testcontainers and `@QuarkusTestResource` within out tests as well.
If I find some time, I'll try to work on a reproducer.

> I am unable to provide a heap dump unfortunately due to company security policies.

Could you have a look at the heap dumpsu using VisualVM or Eclipse MAT? There might be some very obvious culprits?

issue.title: Revert "Execute simple JUnit tests and @QuarkusComponentTest first"
issue.body:
This reverts commit 3b89af2de24c3d95f36de5a3d2f65684a16fe52a.

It has been causing various issues, probably caused by some isolation problems.
Holly's patch should fix the problem so let's wait for it to be in before reapplying this.

Fixes #46459

/cc @holly-cummins

body: It will be interesting to see if https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/34681 causes this to reappear, either by increasing the memory pressure in general, or recreating the leak created by re-ordering the tests. I mean "interesting" in a bad way, of course.
